How to Install pbgenomicconsensus on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • pbgenomicconsensus

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install pbgenomicconsensus on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing pbgenomicconsensus on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall pbgenomicconsensus in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install pbgenomicconsensus, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install pbgenomicconsensus Using apt

To install pbgenomicconsensus in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install pbgenomicconsensus using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install pbgenomicconsensus

The installation of pbgenomicconsensus might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install pbgenomicconsensus Using apt-get

To install pbgenomicconsensus using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install pbgenomicconsensus.

sudo apt-get -y install pbgenomicconsensus

Install pbgenomicconsensus Using Synaptic

To install pbgenomicconsensus using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install pbgenomicconsensus on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for pbgenomicconsensus. This will display the pbgenomicconsensus package in the package window, now to install pbgenomicconsensus, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the pbgenomicconsensus package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of pbgenomicconsensus.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install pbgenomicconsensus Using aptitude

To install pbgenomicconsensus on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of pbgenomicconsensus.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install pbgenomicconsensus using the command aptitude install pbgenomicconsensus.

sudo aptitude -y install pbgenomicconsensus

How to Upgrade pbgenomicconsensus on debian

If you want to upgrade the pbgenomicconsensus package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade pbgenomicconsensus to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade pbgenomicconsensus.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade pbgenomicconsensus sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade pbgenomicconsensus

Upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using Aptitude

To upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade pbgenomicconsensus.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade pbgenomicconsensus

Upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using Synaptic

To upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for pbgenomicconsensus, now right-click pbgenomicconsensus, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade pbgenomicconsensus just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall pbgenomicconsensus on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall pbgenomicconsensus from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just pbgenomicconsensus, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove pbgenomicconsensus

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of pbgenomicconsensus

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of pbgenomicconsensus you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge pbgenomicconsensus

Remove pbgenomicconsensus using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall pbgenomicconsensus using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for pbgenomicconsensus, right-click the pbgenomicconsensus package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall pbgenomicconsensus click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install pbgenomicconsensus on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade pbgenomicconsensus using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of pbgenomicconsensus then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
